docs.snippet: Qatar's government communications office has filed a U.S. lawsuit against people who it said are conducting an illegal social media and internet campaign to spread false information and hurt the country's businesses.

headline.print_headline: Qatar Sues Online Critics of Its Government: U.S. Lawsuit
headline.main: Qatar Sues Online Critics of Its Government: U.S. Lawsuit

docs.snippet: New York City in 1975 was experiencing perhaps the worst moment in its history. The photographer Meryl Meisler loved it immediately.

headline.print_headline: A Dirty, Broke and Wonderful New York
headline.main: A Photographer’s Search for Joy in Uncertain Times

docs.snippet: Indonesia's normally bustling Bali has shut down social media, closed the airport and shuttered all shops for a Day of Silence that marks New Year on the predominantly Hindu resort island.

headline.print_headline: Bali's Day of Silence Shuts Airport, Clears Beaches, Streets
headline.main: Bali's Day of Silence Shuts Airport, Clears Beaches, Streets

docs.snippet: Ukraine's plans to force activists and non-governmental organizations to declare detailed financial information are likely to have a chilling effect on civil society, two leading international rights bodies said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Ukraine NGO Laws Risk 'Chilling Effect' on Civil Society: Rights Bodies
headline.main: Ukraine NGO Laws Risk 'Chilling Effect' on Civil Society: Rights Bodies

docs.snippet: He and Robert Seguso formed one of the top tennis teams of the 1980s, reaching No. 1 in the men’s doubles rankings in 1985.

headline.print_headline: Ken Flach, 54, Doubles Champion Who Captured Six Grand Slams
headline.main: Ken Flach, Who Won Six Grand Slam Doubles Titles, Dies at 54

docs.snippet: Ahead of the first #MeToo Oscars, here’s a look at the staff who are The Times’s journalistic front line.

headline.main: How the New York Times Social Media Desk Covers the Oscars

docs.snippet: Dropbox faces fierce competition, doesn’t make a profit and its user growth has slowed. Yet investors think the company has an amazing future.

headline.main: Dropbox’s First-Day Pop Should Give Investors Pause: DealBook Briefing

docs.snippet: The S&P 500 and the Dow rose on Tuesday, led by gains in industrial and consumer staple shares, while weakness in technology stocks dragged down the Nasdaq.

headline.print_headline: Wall Street Wavers After Strong Rally, Tech Stocks Struggle
headline.main: Wall Street Wavers After Strong Rally, Tech Stocks Struggle

docs.snippet: Technology companies led European stocks lower on Wednesday on persistent concerns over a regulatory crackdown and falls in major tech stocks overnight.

headline.print_headline: European Shares Feel Force of Tech Stock Sell-Off
headline.main: European Shares Feel Force of Tech Stock Sell-Off

docs.snippet: Shares of Nvidia and Tesla were among the biggest losers in trading on Tuesday, as investors continued to lose interest in the once-hot tech sector.

headline.print_headline: A Rough Stretch for the Cars of the Future Drags Down Tech Shares
headline.main: Technology Companies Drag Stock Markets Down Again
